text: Terraform will be irrelevant in 3 years. AI agents will generate and apply infra changes directly.
Service meshes are the new SOAP. Fight me.
If your AI agent can't roll back its own deployment, it's just a fancy cron job.
The best observability tool is an engineer who actually reads the logs.
RAG is just ETL with a marketing budget.
Platform engineering is just DevOps rebranded by people who got tired of being on-call.
Running LLMs on Kubernetes is like driving a Formula 1 car in Bengaluru traffic. Technically possible, practically unhinged.
If you're not using eBPF for observability in 2026, you're basically reading tea leaves.
Multi-cloud is just multi-bill. Nobody actually runs stateful workloads across three providers. Nobody.
The 'shift left' movement has shifted so far left it's now the developer's problem to also be a network engineer, security analyst, and DBA. Cool cool cool.
YAML engineers are the most underpaid systems architects on the planet.
Your 'microservices architecture' is just a distributed monolith with extra network latency and a Jira board.
AI agents will replace the on-call engineer before they replace the software engineer. And honestly? Good.
Scale-to-zero is the most underrated feature in cloud computing. If your GPU pods aren't doing it, you're burning money for fun.
The Kubernetes ecosystem has more CNCF projects than actual production users of those projects.
Prompt engineering is not engineering. It's just talking to a computer with extra steps and a LinkedIn title.
